item.title: How Conservatives Relate to Washington’s Continental Army
item.description:
Did you know there is no federal holiday called Presidents Day?
Today is Washington’s Birthday. As a posthumous birthday gift to our first president and commander-in-chief of the army that won our war for independence, I offer a simple wish: that the army of liberty formed in February 2009, known as “the Tea Party,” will resist the temptation to resign. That’s a great word for what a lot of us feel these days: resignation.
